intro: Rodriguezia stricta, commonly known as the rigid rodriguezia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its evergreen, compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually greenish-white with a strong scent, attracting pollinators like insects and birds. The fruit is a berry that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
